description:
Tree works in front subject to Charterhouse EC1 Tree Preservation Order No.144 1994.  Works:- 

 Plane (T28):    Crown reduce 25%, reduce heavy limbs to                 north by 30%, deadwood. 

 Plane (T24):    Crown thin 25%, crown thin large limb in                 easterly direction by 35%-40%, deadwood. 

 Plane (T40):    Remove epicormic growth and deadwood. 

 Plane (T34):    Crown thin by 35%-40% the large horizontal                 limbs growing in a south/south easterly                 direction, deadwood. 

 Plane (T34):    Crown thin by 35%, deadwood. 

 Plane (T37):    Crown thin by 35%, also thin by 40% large                 southerly limb, deadwood. 

 Plane (T36):    Crown reduce by 25%, crown thin 35%, crown                 lift to 6m, deadwood. 

 Plane (T35):    Undertake climbing inspection and report                 results to local authority. 

 Plane (T31):    Undertake climbing inspection and report                 results to local authority. 

 Plane (T33):    Remove trunk growth, reduce split limb, by                 20%, deadwood. 

 Plane (T15):    Crown thin 25%, reduce epicormic growth,                 deadwood. 

 Hawthorns (3) (T16,T17,T8):  Crown reduce 15%-20%, deadwood.
decision_conditions:
CONDITION: All the work is to be carried out by a competent Tree Surgeon to the recommendation of BS 3998: 1989 'Tree Work'. 

 REASON: To protect the health and stability of trees to be retained on the site, and to ensure that a satisfactory standard of visual amenity is provided and maintained.
